result.execSummary:
The defendant Jim Lee Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not be present in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale/serving of alcohol.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jim Lee Boyd

22A 155725
Apply bond of $307 to case 21CF527 per Order to Apply Bond dated 9/2/22

Order to apply bond on 21CF527, 22CF76 and 22CF134 to costs on 21CF527 and 22CF76
(Copy mailed to Defendant and Poster, 9/2/22)

Defendant Jim Lee Boyd in court.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Jim Lee Boyd.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. CASES CALLED:  21CF527, 22CF76, 22CF134.  Agreement reached.  State moves to amend charge to Misd Bail Jumping, 946.49(1)(a); Court so orders.   State indicates they have no objection to early termination of probation if DOC recommends. Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct 1.  Statements from State and counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Any cash bond in all cases to be applied to cost of OWI TAD program - any balance to then be applied to financial obligations in 21CF527 & 22CF76 w/any outstanding obligations to be paid as a condition of probation.
Status hearing on August 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Jim Lee Boyd in court.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Jim Lee Boyd.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has family emergency; requests adjournment. Case is resolved.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jim Lee Boyd in court. Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Jim Lee Boyd. Def waives preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and binds def over. Arraignment scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
